headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN. BOARD OF COUNCILMEN. Report upon the Exben Overpayment. The Lager-Bier Case. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS Comptroller Flag Sustained. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS.

docs.abstract: Lager Bier not intoxicating - experiments of Sunday Germans
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, President CLANCY in the Chair. A resolution was referred to the Committee on Fi. nance, that the Comptroller be directed to pay the inspectors of all streets employed by the late Superiutendent of Street Improvements, Chas H. Ring, upon their presenting him with proper vouchers.

headline.main: SOCIAL MORALS IN PARIS.; Cars of Foundlings--Changes of Policy on the Subject--Prevision for the Children of the Poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is no sadder sight in France than one of those long processions of orphan girls, (enfants trouvees.) preceded and followed by their guardians and protectors, the Sisters of Charity. They are recognized by a light blue ribbon which passes over both shoulders and joins in front at the waist.

docs.abstract: Lord Napier on the abuse of our flag
docs.lead_paragraph: The U. B M. steamship Black Wrarrier, J. W. SMITH Commander, from Havana on the 10th inst., arrived at this port early yesterday mornings The aggressions of the English gun-boats continue. A few days since they landedd a detachment of marines at one of the out-ports of the Island, and searched the plantations in the vicinity for Bzal negroes, but found none.

docs.snippet: The frigate Wabash has everything in readiness for sea, and will sail for the Mediterranean on or about June 1, unless, as there is some reason to expect, her destination may be temporarily changed to the Gulf Squadron. The Secretary of the Navy...
docs.lead_paragraph: The frigate Wabash has everything in readiness for sea, and will sail for the Mediterranean on or about June 1, unless, as there is some reason to expect, her destination may be temporarily changed to the Gulf Squadron. The Secretary of the Navy telegraphed to Norfolk too late to detain the Colorado, she having already sailed from Hampton Roads for the Gulf, as the flag-ship of the Home Squadron.

docs.snippet: When Captain SANDS, of the steam-frigate Susquchanna, was arrested last month, for refusing to comply with the orders of the Health Officer at Quarautine, it was shown that he was guilty of a misdemeanor which subjected him to the penalty of fine and...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Captain SANDS, of the steam-frigate Susquchanna, was arrested last month, for refusing to comply with the orders of the Health Officer at Quarautine, it was shown that he was guilty of a misdemeanor which subjected him to the penalty of fine and imprisonment, and he at once yielded to the Quarantine authorities.

headline.main: The Quarantine Trouble of the Persia.

docs.abstract: Arrest of Capt Judkins of the Persia
docs.lead_paragraph: The case of the Persia, detained at Quarantine on account of Small-Pox on board, and the conflicting jurisdiction of the Custom-House and Health Officers, has led to a correspondence, of which the following is the substance. Dr. THOMPSON's letter rehearses the history of the-case. Mayor TIEMANN'S expounds the law in the matter.

docs.snippet: At a late hour last night, Mr. ANSON G. PHELPS, while sitting in his own house, suddenly fell dead. Although for some time past Mr. PHELPS had occasionally experienced a strange sensation about the heart, we understand that his health had been good,...

headline.main: Death of Anson G. Phelps, Esq. At a late hour last night, Mr. ANSON G. PHELPS while sitting in his own house, suddenly fell dead.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a late hour last night, Mr. ANSON G. PHELPS, while sitting in his own house, suddenly fell dead. Although for some time past Mr. PHELPS had occasionally experienced a strange sensation about the heart, we understand that his health had been good, and that his decease was most sudden and unexpected.
